name: id
desc: Component ID, not specified by default. If specified, it can be used to refer the component in option or API.

name: name
desc: Series name used for displaying in [tooltip](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#tooltip) and filtering with [legend](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend), or updating data and configuration with `setOption`.

name: min
desc: The specified minimum value.

name: max
desc: The specified maximum value.

name: minSize
desc:
The mapped width from minimum data value [min](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-funnel.min).

It can be absolute pixel and also the percentage of [layout width](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-funnel.width). If you don't want the graph of minimum value to be a triangle, you can set up this property larger than 0.

name: maxSize
desc:
The mapped width from maximum data value [max](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-funnel.max).

It can be absolute pixel and also the percentage of [layout width](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-funnel.width).

name: orient
desc: Orient of funnelï¼ŒCan be `'vertical'` or `'horizontal'`.

name: sort
desc: Data sorting, which can be whether `'ascending'`, `'descending'`, `'none'`(in data order) or a function, which is the same as `Array.prototype.sort(function (a, b) { ... })`;

name: gap
desc: Gap between each trapezoid.

name: legendHoverLink
desc: Whether to enable highlighting chart when [legend](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend) is being hovered.

name: funnelAlign
desc: Horizontal align. Defaults to align center. Can be 'left', 'right', 'center'.

name: label
desc: Text label of funnel chart, to explain some data information about graphic item like value, name and so on. `label` is placed under `itemStyle` in ECharts 2.x. In ECharts 3, to make the configuration structure flatter, `label`is taken to be at the same level with `itemStyle`, and has `emphasis` as `itemStyle` does.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Label position.

**Options: **
+ `'left'`Left side of funnel chart. Available when [orient](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-funnel.orient) is `'vertical'`.
+ `'right'` Right side of funnel chart. Available when [orient](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-funnel.orient) is `'horizontal'`.
+ `'top'` Top side of funnel chart. Available when [orient](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-funnel.orient) is `'vertical'`.
+ `'bottom'` Bottom side of funnel chart. Available when [orient](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-funnel.orient) is `'vertical'`.
+ `'inside'`Inside the trapezoid of funnel chart.
+ `'insideRight'`Right inside the trapezoid of funnel chart.
+ `'insideLeft'`Left inside the trapezoid of funnel chart.
+ `'leftTop'`Top-left of funnel chart.
+ `'leftBottom'`Bottom-left of funnel chart.
+ `'rightTop'`Top-right side of funnel chart.
+ `'rightBottom'`Bottom-right side of funnel chart.
+ `'inner'` equals to `'inside'`.
+ `'center'` equals to `'inside'`.

[labelLine](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-funnel.labelLine) can be used to guide to the corresponding trapezoid when label is not inside.

lineHeight
children.desc:
Line height of the text fragment.



If `lineHeight` is not set in `rich`, `lineHeight` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
lineHeight: 56,
rich: {
a: {
// `lineHeight` is not set, then it will be 56
}
}
}
```




### backgroundColor(string|Object)='transparent'

Background color of the text fragment.

Can be color string, like `'#123234'`, `'red'`, `'rgba(0,23,11,0.3)'`.

Or image can be used, for example:

```js
backgroundColor: {
image: 'xxx/xxx.png'
// It can be URL of a image,
// or dataURI,
// or HTMLImageElement,
// or HTMLCanvasElement.
}
```

`width` or `height` can be specified when using background image, or
auto adapted by default.



### borderColor(Color)='transparent'

Border color of the text fragment.



### borderWidth(number)=0

Border width of the text fragment.

### borderRadius(number)=0

Border radius of the text fragment.

### padding(number|Array)=0

Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

### shadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text block.

### shadowBlur(number)=0

Show blur of the text block.

### shadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text block.

### shadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.


### textBorderColor(Color)='transparent'

Storke color of the text.




### textBorderWidth(number)=0

Storke line width of the text.

### textShadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text itself.

### textShadowBlur(number)=0

Shadow blue of the text itself.

### textShadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text itself.

### textShadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

name: labelLine
desc: The visual guide line style of label. When [label position](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-funnel.label.position) is set as `'left'`or`'right'`, the visual guide line will show.

children.name: length

children.name: lineStyle
children.desc:
#### color(Color)= "#000"

Line color.





> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.
> ```js
> // Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
> color: {
>     type: 'linear',
>     x: 0,
>     y: 0,
>     x2: 0,
>     y2: 1,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
> color: {
>     type: 'radial',
>     x: 0.5,
>     y: 0.5,
>     r: 0.5,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Fill with texture
> color: {
>     image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
>     repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
> }
> ```

### color(Color|Function)=null

color.  Color is taken from [option.color Palette](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#color) by default.



> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.
> ```js
> // Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
> color: {
>     type: 'linear',
>     x: 0,
>     y: 0,
>     x2: 0,
>     y2: 1,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
> color: {
>     type: 'radial',
>     x: 0.5,
>     y: 0.5,
>     r: 0.5,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Fill with texture
> color: {
>     image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
>     repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
> }
> ```



Supports callback functions, in the form of:
```js
(params: Object) => Color
```
Input parameters are `seriesIndex`, `dataIndex`, `data`, `value`, and etc. of data item.

name: zlevel
desc:
`zlevel` value of all graphical elements in .

`zlevel` is used to make layers with Canvas. Graphical elements with different `zlevel` values will be placed in different Canvases, which is a common optimization technique. We can put those frequently changed elements (like those with animations) to a separate `zlevel`. Notice that too many Canvases will increase memory cost, and should be used carefully on mobile phones to avoid crash.

Canvases with bigger `zlevel` will be placed on Canvases with smaller `zlevel`.

name: z
desc:
`z` value of all graphical elements in , which controls order of drawing graphical components. Components with smaller `z` values may be overwritten by those with larger `z` values.

`z` has a lower priority to `zlevel`, and will not create new Canvas.

name: left
desc:
Distance between funnel chart component and the left side of the container.

`left` value can be instant pixel value like `20`; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like `'20%'`; and it can also be `'left'`, `'center'`, or `'right'`.

If the `left` value is set to be `'left'`, `'center'`, or `'right'`, then the component will be aligned automatically based on position.

name: top
desc:
Distance between funnel chart component and the top side of the container.

`top` value can be instant pixel value like `20`; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like `'20%'`; and it can also be `'top'`, `'middle'`, or `'bottom'`.

If the `left` value is set to be `'top'`, `'middle'`, or `'bottom'`, then the component will be aligned automatically based on position.

name: right
desc:
Distance between funnel chart component and the right side of the container.

`right` value can be instant pixel value like `20`; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like `'20%'`.

name: bottom
desc:
Distance between funnel chart component and the bottom side of the container.

`bottom` value can be instant pixel value like `20`; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like `'20%'`.

name: width
desc: Width of funnel chart component. Adaptive by default.

name: height
desc: Height of funnel chart component. Adaptive by default.

name: seriesLayoutBy
desc:
When [dataset](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#dataset) is used, `seriesLayoutBy` specifies whether the column or the row of `dataset` is mapped to the series, namely, the series is "layout" on columns or rows. Optional values:

+ 'column': by default, the columns of `dataset` are mapped the series. In this case, each column represents a dimension.
+ 'row'ï¼šthe rows of `dataset` are mapped to the series. In this case, each row represents a dimension.

Check this [example](dataset-series-layout-by).

name: datasetIndex
desc: If [series.data](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series.data) is not specified, and [dataset](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#dataset) exists, the series will use `dataset`. `datasetIndex` specifies which dataset will be used.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Label position.

**Options: **
+ `'left'`Left side of funnel chart. Available when [orient](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-funnel.orient) is `'vertical'`.
+ `'right'` Right side of funnel chart. Available when [orient](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-funnel.orient) is `'horizontal'`.
+ `'top'` Top side of funnel chart. Available when [orient](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-funnel.orient) is `'vertical'`.
+ `'bottom'` Bottom side of funnel chart. Available when [orient](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-funnel.orient) is `'vertical'`.
+ `'inside'`Inside the trapezoid of funnel chart.
+ `'insideRight'`Right inside the trapezoid of funnel chart.
+ `'insideLeft'`Left inside the trapezoid of funnel chart.
+ `'leftTop'`Top-left of funnel chart.
+ `'leftBottom'`Bottom-left of funnel chart.
+ `'rightTop'`Top-right side of funnel chart.
+ `'rightBottom'`Bottom-right side of funnel chart.
+ `'inner'` equals to `'inside'`.
+ `'center'` equals to `'inside'`.

[labelLine](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-funnel.labelLine) can be used to guide to the corresponding trapezoid when label is not inside.

Horizontal alignment of text, automatic by default.

Padding of the text fragment, for example:

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: borderType
children.desc: Border type, which can be `'solid'`, `'dashed'`, or `'dotted'`. `'solid'` by default.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

children.name: show
children.desc:
##### color(Color)="#fff"

text color.





##### fontStyle(string)='normal'

font style.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'italic'`
+ `'oblique'`


##### fontWeight(string|number)=normal

font thick weight.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'bold'`
+ `'bolder'`
+ `'lighter'`
+ 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...


##### fontFamily(string)='sans-serif'

font family.

Can also be 'serif' , 'monospace', ...

##### fontSize(number)=12

font size.



##### align(string)=

Horizontal alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'left'`
+ `'center'`
+ `'right'`



If `align` is not set in `rich`, `align` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
align: right,
rich: {
a: {
// `align` is not set, then it will be right
}
}
}
```




##### verticalAlign(string)=

Vertical alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'top'`
+ `'middle'`
+ `'bottom'`



If `verticalAlign` is not set in `rich`, `verticalAlign` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
verticalAlign: bottom,
rich: {
a: {
// `verticalAlign` is not set, then it will be bottom
}
}
}
```

children.name: lineHeight
children.desc:
Line height of the text fragment.



If `lineHeight` is not set in `rich`, `lineHeight` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
lineHeight: 56,
rich: {
a: {
// `lineHeight` is not set, then it will be 56
}
}
}
```




##### backgroundColor(string|Object)='transparent'

Background color of the text fragment.

Can be color string, like `'#123234'`, `'red'`, `'rgba(0,23,11,0.3)'`.

Or image can be used, for example:

```js
backgroundColor: {
image: 'xxx/xxx.png'
// It can be URL of a image,
// or dataURI,
// or HTMLImageElement,
// or HTMLCanvasElement.
}
```

`width` or `height` can be specified when using background image, or
auto adapted by default.



##### borderColor(Color)='transparent'

Border color of the text fragment.



##### borderWidth(number)=0

Border width of the text fragment.

##### borderRadius(number)=0

Border radius of the text fragment.

##### padding(number|Array)=0

Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

##### shadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text block.

##### shadowBlur(number)=0

Show blur of the text block.

##### shadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text block.

##### shadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.


##### textBorderColor(Color)='transparent'

Storke color of the text.




##### textBorderWidth(number)=0

Storke line width of the text.

##### textShadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text itself.

##### textShadowBlur(number)=0

Shadow blue of the text itself.

##### textShadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text itself.

##### textShadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

children.desc:
###### color(Color)= "#000"

Line color.





> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.
> ```js
> // Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
> color: {
>     type: 'linear',
>     x: 0,
>     y: 0,
>     x2: 0,
>     y2: 1,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
> color: {
>     type: 'radial',
>     x: 0.5,
>     y: 0.5,
>     r: 0.5,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Fill with texture
> color: {
>     image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
>     repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
> }
> ```

name: markPoint
desc: Mark point in a chart.

children.name: symbol
children.desc:
Symbol of mark point.



Icon types provided by ECharts includes
`'circle'`, `'rect'`, `'roundRect'`, `'triangle'`, `'diamond'`, `'pin'`, `'arrow'`, `'none'`






It can be set to an image with `'image://url'` , in which URL is the link to an image, or `dataURI` of an image.


An image URL example:

```
'image://http://xxx.xxx.xxx/a/b.png'
```

A `dataURI` example:

```
'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'
```


Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via `'path://'` in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. Refer to [SVG PathData](http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathData) for more information about the format of the path. You may export vector paths from tools like Adobe

For example:

```
'path://M30.9,53.2C16.8,53.2,5.3,41.7,5.3,27.6S16.8,2,30.9,2C45,2,56.4,13.5,56.4,27.6S45,53.2,30.9,53.2z M30.9,3.5C17.6,3.5,6.8,14.4,6.8,27.6c0,13.3,10.8,24.1,24.101,24.1C44.2,51.7,55,40.9,55,27.6C54.9,14.4,44.1,3.5,30.9,3.5z M36.9,35.8c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H36c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1V35.8z M27.8,35.8 c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H27c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1L27.8,35.8L27.8,35.8z'
```





















If symbols needs to be different, you can set with callback function in the following format:
```js
(value: Array|number, params: Object) => string
```
The first parameter `value` is the value in [data](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-funnel.data), and the second parameter `params` is the rest parameters of data item.

children.name: symbolSize
children.desc:
mark point symbol size. It can be set to single numbers like `10`, or use an array to represent width and height. For example, `[20, 10]` means symbol width is `20`, and height is`10`.


If size of symbols needs to be different, you can set with callback function in the following format:
```js
(value: Array|number, params: Object) => number|Array
```
The first parameter `value` is the value in [data](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-funnel.data), and the second parameter `params` is the rest parameters of data item.

children.name: symbolRotate
children.desc:
Rotate degree of mark point symbol. The negative value represents clockwise. Note that when `symbol` is set to be `'arrow'` in `markLine`, `symbolRotate` value will be ignored, and compulsively use tangent angle.


If rotation of symbols needs to be different, you can set with callback function in the following format:
```js
(value: Array|number, params: Object) => number
```
The first parameter `value` is the value in [data](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-funnel.data), and the second parameter `params` is the rest parameters of data item.
> Callback is supported since 4.8.0 .

children.name: symbolKeepAspect
children.desc: Whether to keep aspect for symbols in the form of `path://`.

children.name: symbolOffset
children.desc:
Offset of mark point symbol relative to original position. By default, symbol will be put in the center position of data. But if symbol is from user-defined vector path or image, you may not expect symbol to be in center. In this case, you may use this attribute to set offset to default position. It can be in absolute pixel value, or in relative percentage value.

For example, `[0, '50%']` means to move upside side position of symbol height. It can be used to make the arrow in the bottom to be at data position when symbol is pin.

children.name: silent
children.desc: Whether to ignore mouse events. Default value is false, for triggering and responding to mouse events.

children.name: label
children.desc: Label of mark point.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether to show label.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Label position.

**Followings are the options: **

+ [x, y]

Use relative percentage, or absolute pixel values to represent position of label relative to top-left corner of bounding box.
For example:
```js
// Absolute pixel values
position: [10, 10],
// Relative percentage
position: ['50%', '50%']
```

+ 'top'
+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomRight'

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: distance
children.desc:
Distance to the host graphic element. Works when position is string value (like `'top'`ã€`'insideRight'`).

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: rotate
children.desc:
Rotate label, from -90 degree to 90, positive value represents rotate anti-clockwise.

See: [label rotation](bar-label-rotation).

children.name: offset
children.desc: Whether to move text slightly. For example: `[30, 40]` means move `30` horizontally and move `40` vertically.

children.name: formatter
lineHeight
children.desc:
Line height of the text fragment.



If `lineHeight` is not set in `rich`, `lineHeight` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
lineHeight: 56,
rich: {
a: {
// `lineHeight` is not set, then it will be 56
}
}
}
```

children.desc:
###### color(Color)="#fff"

text color.




If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.









###### fontStyle(string)='normal'

font style.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'italic'`
+ `'oblique'`


###### fontWeight(string|number)=normal

font thick weight.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'bold'`
+ `'bolder'`
+ `'lighter'`
+ 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...


###### fontFamily(string)='sans-serif'

font family.

Can also be 'serif' , 'monospace', ...

###### fontSize(number)=12

font size.



###### align(string)=

Horizontal alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'left'`
+ `'center'`
+ `'right'`



If `align` is not set in `rich`, `align` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
align: right,
rich: {
a: {
// `align` is not set, then it will be right
}
}
}
```




###### verticalAlign(string)=

Vertical alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'top'`
+ `'middle'`
+ `'bottom'`



If `verticalAlign` is not set in `rich`, `verticalAlign` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
verticalAlign: bottom,
rich: {
a: {
// `verticalAlign` is not set, then it will be bottom
}
}
}
```

children.name: lineHeight
children.desc:
Line height of the text fragment.



If `lineHeight` is not set in `rich`, `lineHeight` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
lineHeight: 56,
rich: {
a: {
// `lineHeight` is not set, then it will be 56
}
}
}
```




###### backgroundColor(string|Object)='transparent'

Background color of the text fragment.

Can be color string, like `'#123234'`, `'red'`, `'rgba(0,23,11,0.3)'`.

Or image can be used, for example:

```js
backgroundColor: {
image: 'xxx/xxx.png'
// It can be URL of a image,
// or dataURI,
// or HTMLImageElement,
// or HTMLCanvasElement.
}
```

`width` or `height` can be specified when using background image, or
auto adapted by default.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








###### borderColor(Color)='transparent'

Border color of the text fragment.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








###### borderWidth(number)=0

Border width of the text fragment.

###### borderRadius(number)=0

Border radius of the text fragment.

###### padding(number|Array)=0

Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

###### shadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text block.

###### shadowBlur(number)=0

Show blur of the text block.

###### shadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text block.

###### shadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.


###### textBorderColor(Color)='transparent'

Storke color of the text.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.









###### textBorderWidth(number)=0

Storke line width of the text.

###### textShadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text itself.

###### textShadowBlur(number)=0

Shadow blue of the text itself.

###### textShadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text itself.

###### textShadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether to show label.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Label position.

**Followings are the options: **

+ [x, y]

Use relative percentage, or absolute pixel values to represent position of label relative to top-left corner of bounding box.
For example:
```js
// Absolute pixel values
position: [10, 10],
// Relative percentage
position: ['50%', '50%']
```

+ 'top'
+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomRight'

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: distance
children.desc:
Distance to the host graphic element. Works when position is string value (like `'top'`ã€`'insideRight'`).

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: rotate
children.desc:
Rotate label, from -90 degree to 90, positive value represents rotate anti-clockwise.

See: [label rotation](bar-label-rotation).

children.name: offset
children.desc: Whether to move text slightly. For example: `[30, 40]` means move `30` horizontally and move `40` vertically.

children.name: itemStyle
children.desc:
Mark point style.


#### color(Color)=null

color.



> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.
> ```js
> // Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
> color: {
>     type: 'linear',
>     x: 0,
>     y: 0,
>     x2: 0,
>     y2: 1,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
> color: {
>     type: 'radial',
>     x: 0.5,
>     y: 0.5,
>     r: 0.5,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Fill with texture
> color: {
>     image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
>     repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
> }
> ```

children.name: borderColor
children.desc: border color, whose format is similar to that of `color`.

children.name: borderWidth
children.desc: border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

children.name: borderType
children.desc: Border type, which can be `'solid'`, `'dashed'`, or `'dotted'`. `'solid'` by default.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

children.name: data
children.desc:
Data array for mark points, each of which is an object. Here are some ways to assign mark point position.
1. Assign coordinate according to container with [x](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-funnel.markPoint.data.x), [y](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-funnel.markPoint.data.y) attribute, in which pixel values and percentage are supported.

When multiple attributes exist, priority is as the above order.

**For example: **
```js
data: [
{
name: 'screen coordinate',
x: 100,
y: 100
}
]
```

children.name: name
children.desc: Mark point name.

children.name: x
children.desc: X position according to container, in pixel.

children.name: y
children.desc: Y position according to container, in pixel.

children.name: value
children.desc: Label value, which can be ignored.

children.name: symbol
children.desc:
Symbol of mark point.



Icon types provided by ECharts includes
`'circle'`, `'rect'`, `'roundRect'`, `'triangle'`, `'diamond'`, `'pin'`, `'arrow'`, `'none'`






It can be set to an image with `'image://url'` , in which URL is the link to an image, or `dataURI` of an image.


An image URL example:

```
'image://http://xxx.xxx.xxx/a/b.png'
```

A `dataURI` example:

```
'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'
```


Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via `'path://'` in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. Refer to [SVG PathData](http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathData) for more information about the format of the path. You may export vector paths from tools like Adobe

For example:

```
'path://M30.9,53.2C16.8,53.2,5.3,41.7,5.3,27.6S16.8,2,30.9,2C45,2,56.4,13.5,56.4,27.6S45,53.2,30.9,53.2z M30.9,3.5C17.6,3.5,6.8,14.4,6.8,27.6c0,13.3,10.8,24.1,24.101,24.1C44.2,51.7,55,40.9,55,27.6C54.9,14.4,44.1,3.5,30.9,3.5z M36.9,35.8c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H36c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1V35.8z M27.8,35.8 c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H27c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1L27.8,35.8L27.8,35.8z'
```

children.name: symbolSize
children.desc: mark point symbol size. It can be set to single numbers like `10`, or use an array to represent width and height. For example, `[20, 10]` means symbol width is `20`, and height is`10`.

children.name: symbolRotate
children.desc: Rotate degree of mark point symbol. The negative value represents clockwise. Note that when `symbol` is set to be `'arrow'` in `markLine`, `symbolRotate` value will be ignored, and compulsively use tangent angle.

children.name: symbolKeepAspect
children.desc: Whether to keep aspect for symbols in the form of `path://`.

children.name: symbolOffset
children.desc:
Offset of mark point symbol relative to original position. By default, symbol will be put in the center position of data. But if symbol is from user-defined vector path or image, you may not expect symbol to be in center. In this case, you may use this attribute to set offset to default position. It can be in absolute pixel value, or in relative percentage value.

For example, `[0, '50%']` means to move upside side position of symbol height. It can be used to make the arrow in the bottom to be at data position when symbol is pin.

children.name: itemStyle
children.desc:
Mark point style.

children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

children.name: emphasis
children.desc:
###### color(Color)=null

color.



> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.
> ```js
> // Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
> color: {
>     type: 'linear',
>     x: 0,
>     y: 0,
>     x2: 0,
>     y2: 1,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
> color: {
>     type: 'radial',
>     x: 0.5,
>     y: 0.5,
>     r: 0.5,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Fill with texture
> color: {
>     image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
>     repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
> }
> ```

children.name: borderColor
children.desc: border color, whose format is similar to that of `color`.

children.name: borderWidth
children.desc: border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

children.name: borderType
children.desc: Border type, which can be `'solid'`, `'dashed'`, or `'dotted'`. `'solid'` by default.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether to show label.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Label position.

**Followings are the options: **

+ [x, y]

Use relative percentage, or absolute pixel values to represent position of label relative to top-left corner of bounding box.
For example:
```js
// Absolute pixel values
position: [10, 10],
// Relative percentage
position: ['50%', '50%']
```

+ 'top'
+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomRight'

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: distance
children.desc:
Distance to the host graphic element. Works when position is string value (like `'top'`ã€`'insideRight'`).

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: rotate
children.desc:
Rotate label, from -90 degree to 90, positive value represents rotate anti-clockwise.

See: [label rotation](bar-label-rotation).

children.name: offset
children.desc:
Whether to move text slightly. For example: `[30, 40]` means move `30` horizontally and move `40` vertically.








##### color(Color)="#fff"

text color.




If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.









##### fontStyle(string)='normal'

font style.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'italic'`
+ `'oblique'`


##### fontWeight(string|number)=normal

font thick weight.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'bold'`
+ `'bolder'`
+ `'lighter'`
+ 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...


##### fontFamily(string)='sans-serif'

font family.

Can also be 'serif' , 'monospace', ...

##### fontSize(number)=12

font size.



##### align(string)=

Horizontal alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'left'`
+ `'center'`
+ `'right'`



If `align` is not set in `rich`, `align` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
align: right,
rich: {
a: {
// `align` is not set, then it will be right
}
}
}
```




##### verticalAlign(string)=

Vertical alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'top'`
+ `'middle'`
+ `'bottom'`



If `verticalAlign` is not set in `rich`, `verticalAlign` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
verticalAlign: bottom,
rich: {
a: {
// `verticalAlign` is not set, then it will be bottom
}
}
}
```

children.name: lineHeight
children.desc:
Line height of the text fragment.



If `lineHeight` is not set in `rich`, `lineHeight` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
lineHeight: 56,
rich: {
a: {
// `lineHeight` is not set, then it will be 56
}
}
}
```




##### backgroundColor(string|Object)='transparent'

Background color of the text fragment.

Can be color string, like `'#123234'`, `'red'`, `'rgba(0,23,11,0.3)'`.

Or image can be used, for example:

```js
backgroundColor: {
image: 'xxx/xxx.png'
// It can be URL of a image,
// or dataURI,
// or HTMLImageElement,
// or HTMLCanvasElement.
}
```

`width` or `height` can be specified when using background image, or
auto adapted by default.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








##### borderColor(Color)='transparent'

Border color of the text fragment.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








##### borderWidth(number)=0

Border width of the text fragment.

##### borderRadius(number)=0

Border radius of the text fragment.

##### padding(number|Array)=0

Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

##### shadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text block.

##### shadowBlur(number)=0

Show blur of the text block.

##### shadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text block.

##### shadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.


##### textBorderColor(Color)='transparent'

Storke color of the text.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.









##### textBorderWidth(number)=0

Storke line width of the text.

##### textShadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text itself.

##### textShadowBlur(number)=0

Shadow blue of the text itself.

##### textShadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text itself.

##### textShadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

children.name: animation
children.desc: Whether to enable animation.

children.name: animationThreshold
children.desc: Whether to set graphic number threshold to animation. Animation will be disabled when graphic number is larger than threshold.

children.name: animationDuration
animationEasing
children.desc: Easing method used for the first animation. Varied easing effects can be found at [easing effect example](line-easing).

children.name: animationDelay
animationDurationUpdate
animationEasingUpdate
children.desc: Easing method used for animation.

children.name: animationDelayUpdate

name: markLine
desc: Use a line in the chart to illustrate.

children.name: silent
children.desc: Whether to ignore mouse events. Default value is false, for triggering and responding to mouse events.

children.name: symbol
children.desc: Symbol type at the two ends of the mark line. It can be an array for two ends, or assigned seperately. See [data.symbol](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-funnel.markLine.data.0.symbol) for more format information.

children.name: symbolSize
children.desc:
Symbol size at the two ends of the mark line. It can be an array for two ends, or assigned seperately.

**Attention: ** You cannot assgin width and height seperately as normal `symbolSize`.

children.name: precision
children.desc: Precision of marking line value, which is useful when displaying average value mark line.

children.name: label
children.desc: Mark line text.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether show label or not.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Positions of labels can be:
+ `'start'` starting point of the line.
+ `'middle'` middle point of the line.
+ `'end'` ending point of the line.

Since version 4.7.0, more label positions are supported: `'start'`, `'middle'`, `'end'`, `'insideStartTop'`, `'insideStartBottom'`, `'insideMiddleTop'`, `'insideMiddleBottom'`, `'insideEndTop'`, `'insideEndBottom'`.

`'insideMiddleBottom'` is the same as `'middle'`. Position is as the following chart.

####### color(Color)= "#000"

Line color.





> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.
> ```js
> // Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.

>     type: 'linear',
>     x: 0,
>     y: 0,
>     x2: 0,
>     y2: 1,

>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position

>     global: false // false by default
> }

> color: {
>     type: 'radial',
>     x: 0.5,
>     y: 0.5,
>     r: 0.5,

Since version 4.7.0, more label positions are supported: `'start'`, `'middle'`, `'end'`, `'insideStartTop'`, `'insideStartBottom'`, `'insideMiddleTop'`, `'insideMiddleBottom'`, `'insideEndTop'`, `'insideEndBottom'`.

`'insideMiddleBottom'` is the same as `'middle'`. Position is as the following chart.

The distance between labels and mark lines can be set with [label.distance](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-.markLine.label.distance).

~[800x500](bar-markline&reset=1&edit=1)

children.name: position
children.desc:
Label position.

**Followings are the options: **

+ [x, y]

Use relative percentage, or absolute pixel values to represent position of label relative to top-left corner of bounding box.
For example:
```js
// Absolute pixel values
position: [10, 10],
// Relative percentage
position: ['50%', '50%']
```

+ 'top'
+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomRight'

Distance to the host graphic element. Works when position is string value (like `'top'`ã€`'insideRight'`).

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: rotate
children.desc:
Rotate label, from -90 degree to 90, positive value represents rotate anti-clockwise.

See: [label rotation](bar-label-rotation).

children.name: offset
children.desc:
Whether to move text slightly. For example: `[30, 40]` means move `30` horizontally and move `40` vertically.








#### color(Color)="#fff"

text color.




If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.









#### fontStyle(string)='normal'

font style.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'italic'`
+ `'oblique'`


#### fontWeight(string|number)=normal

font thick weight.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'bold'`
+ `'bolder'`
+ `'lighter'`
+ 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...


#### fontFamily(string)='sans-serif'

font family.

Can also be 'serif' , 'monospace', ...

#### fontSize(number)=12

font size.



#### align(string)=

Horizontal alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'left'`
+ `'center'`
+ `'right'`



If `align` is not set in `rich`, `align` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
align: right,
rich: {
a: {
// `align` is not set, then it will be right
}
}
}
```




#### verticalAlign(string)=

Vertical alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'top'`
+ `'middle'`
+ `'bottom'`



If `verticalAlign` is not set in `rich`, `verticalAlign` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
verticalAlign: bottom,
rich: {
a: {
// `verticalAlign` is not set, then it will be bottom
}
}
}
```

children.name: lineHeight
children.desc:
Line height of the text fragment.



If `lineHeight` is not set in `rich`, `lineHeight` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
lineHeight: 56,
rich: {
a: {
// `lineHeight` is not set, then it will be 56
}
}
}
```




#### backgroundColor(string|Object)='transparent'

Background color of the text fragment.

Can be color string, like `'#123234'`, `'red'`, `'rgba(0,23,11,0.3)'`.

Or image can be used, for example:

```js
backgroundColor: {
image: 'xxx/xxx.png'
// It can be URL of a image,
// or dataURI,
// or HTMLImageElement,
// or HTMLCanvasElement.
}
```

`width` or `height` can be specified when using background image, or
auto adapted by default.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








#### borderColor(Color)='transparent'

Border color of the text fragment.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








#### borderWidth(number)=0

Border width of the text fragment.

#### borderRadius(number)=0

Border radius of the text fragment.

#### padding(number|Array)=0

Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

#### shadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text block.

#### shadowBlur(number)=0

Show blur of the text block.

#### shadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text block.

#### shadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.


#### textBorderColor(Color)='transparent'

Storke color of the text.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.









#### textBorderWidth(number)=0

Storke line width of the text.

#### textShadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text itself.

#### textShadowBlur(number)=0

Shadow blue of the text itself.

#### textShadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text itself.

#### textShadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

####### color(Color)="#fff"

text color.




If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.









####### fontStyle(string)='normal'

font style.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'italic'`
+ `'oblique'`


####### fontWeight(string|number)=normal

font thick weight.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'bold'`
+ `'bolder'`
+ `'lighter'`
+ 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...


####### fontFamily(string)='sans-serif'

font family.

Can also be 'serif' , 'monospace', ...

####### fontSize(number)=12

font size.



####### align(string)=

Horizontal alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'left'`
+ `'center'`
+ `'right'`



If `align` is not set in `rich`, `align` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
align: right,
rich: {
a: {
// `align` is not set, then it will be right
}
}
}
```




####### verticalAlign(string)=

Vertical alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'top'`
+ `'middle'`
+ `'bottom'`



If `verticalAlign` is not set in `rich`, `verticalAlign` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
verticalAlign: bottom,
rich: {
a: {
// `verticalAlign` is not set, then it will be bottom
}
}
}
```

children.name: lineHeight
children.desc:
Line height of the text fragment.



If `lineHeight` is not set in `rich`, `lineHeight` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
lineHeight: 56,
rich: {
a: {
// `lineHeight` is not set, then it will be 56
}
}
}
```




####### backgroundColor(string|Object)='transparent'

Background color of the text fragment.

Can be color string, like `'#123234'`, `'red'`, `'rgba(0,23,11,0.3)'`.

Or image can be used, for example:

```js
backgroundColor: {
image: 'xxx/xxx.png'
// It can be URL of a image,
// or dataURI,
// or HTMLImageElement,
// or HTMLCanvasElement.
}
```

`width` or `height` can be specified when using background image, or
auto adapted by default.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








####### borderColor(Color)='transparent'

Border color of the text fragment.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








####### borderWidth(number)=0

Border width of the text fragment.

####### borderRadius(number)=0

Border radius of the text fragment.

####### padding(number|Array)=0

Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

####### shadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text block.

####### shadowBlur(number)=0

Show blur of the text block.

####### shadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text block.

####### shadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.


####### textBorderColor(Color)='transparent'

Storke color of the text.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.









####### textBorderWidth(number)=0

Storke line width of the text.

####### textShadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text itself.

####### textShadowBlur(number)=0

Shadow blue of the text itself.

####### textShadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text itself.

####### textShadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

children.name: itemStyle
children.desc:
Style of the mark area.


#### color(Color)=null

color.



> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.
> ```js
> // Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
> color: {
>     type: 'linear',
>     x: 0,
>     y: 0,
>     x2: 0,
>     y2: 1,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
> color: {
>     type: 'radial',
>     x: 0.5,
>     y: 0.5,
>     r: 0.5,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Fill with texture
> color: {
>     image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
>     repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
> }
> ```

children.name: borderColor
children.desc: border color, whose format is similar to that of `color`.

children.name: borderWidth
children.desc: border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

children.name: borderType
children.desc: Border type, which can be `'solid'`, `'dashed'`, or `'dotted'`. `'solid'` by default.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

children.name: label
children.desc:
Label style of the item.
Label style of start point and end point will be merged together.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether to show label.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Label position.

**Followings are the options: **

+ [x, y]

Use relative percentage, or absolute pixel values to represent position of label relative to top-left corner of bounding box.
For example:
```js
// Absolute pixel values
position: [10, 10],
// Relative percentage
position: ['50%', '50%']
```

+ 'top'
+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomRight'

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: distance
children.desc:
Distance to the host graphic element. Works when position is string value (like `'top'`ã€`'insideRight'`).

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: rotate
children.desc:
Rotate label, from -90 degree to 90, positive value represents rotate anti-clockwise.

See: [label rotation](bar-label-rotation).

children.name: offset
children.desc:
Whether to move text slightly. For example: `[30, 40]` means move `30` horizontally and move `40` vertically.

It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: name
children.desc: Name of the marker, which will display as a label.

children.name: x
children.desc: x value on screen coordinate system, can be pixel number (like `5`), or percent value (like `'20%'`).

children.name: y
children.desc: y value on screen coordinate system, can be pixel number (like `5`), or percent value (like `'20%'`).

children.desc:
Style of the item.
`itemStyle` of start point and end point will be merged together.


###### color(Color)=null

color.



> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.
> ```js
> // Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
> color: {
>     type: 'linear',
>     x: 0,
>     y: 0,
>     x2: 0,
>     y2: 1,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
> color: {
>     type: 'radial',
>     x: 0.5,
>     y: 0.5,
>     r: 0.5,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Fill with texture
> color: {
>     image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
>     repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
> }
> ```

children.name: borderColor
children.desc: border color, whose format is similar to that of `color`.

children.name: borderWidth
children.desc: border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

children.name: borderType
children.desc: Border type, which can be `'solid'`, `'dashed'`, or `'dotted'`. `'solid'` by default.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

######## shadowOffsetY(number)=0

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.


######## textBorderColor(Color)='transparent'

Storke color of the text.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.









######## textBorderWidth(number)=0

Storke line width of the text.

######## textShadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text itself.

######## textShadowBlur(number)=0

Shadow blue of the text itself.

######## textShadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text itself.

Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether to show label.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Label position.

**Followings are the options: **

+ [x, y]

Use relative percentage, or absolute pixel values to represent position of label relative to top-left corner of bounding box.
For example:
```js
// Absolute pixel values
position: [10, 10],
// Relative percentage
position: ['50%', '50%']
```

+ 'top'
+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomRight'

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: distance
children.desc:
Distance to the host graphic element. Works when position is string value (like `'top'`ã€`'insideRight'`).

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: rotate
children.desc:
Rotate label, from -90 degree to 90, positive value represents rotate anti-clockwise.

See: [label rotation](bar-label-rotation).

children.name: offset
children.desc:
Whether to move text slightly. For example: `[30, 40]` means move `30` horizontally and move `40` vertically.








####### color(Color)="#fff"

text color.




If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.









####### fontStyle(string)='normal'

font style.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'italic'`
+ `'oblique'`


####### fontWeight(string|number)=normal

font thick weight.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'bold'`
+ `'bolder'`
+ `'lighter'`
+ 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...


####### fontFamily(string)='sans-serif'

font family.

Can also be 'serif' , 'monospace', ...

####### fontSize(number)=12

font size.



####### align(string)=

Horizontal alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'left'`
+ `'center'`
+ `'right'`



If `align` is not set in `rich`, `align` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
align: right,
rich: {
a: {
// `align` is not set, then it will be right
}
}
}
```




####### verticalAlign(string)=

Vertical alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'top'`
+ `'middle'`
+ `'bottom'`



If `verticalAlign` is not set in `rich`, `verticalAlign` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
verticalAlign: bottom,
rich: {
a: {
// `verticalAlign` is not set, then it will be bottom
}
}
}
```

children.name: lineHeight
children.desc:
Line height of the text fragment.



If `lineHeight` is not set in `rich`, `lineHeight` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
lineHeight: 56,
rich: {
a: {
// `lineHeight` is not set, then it will be 56
}
}
}
```




####### backgroundColor(string|Object)='transparent'

Background color of the text fragment.

Can be color string, like `'#123234'`, `'red'`, `'rgba(0,23,11,0.3)'`.

Or image can be used, for example:

```js
backgroundColor: {
image: 'xxx/xxx.png'
// It can be URL of a image,
// or dataURI,
// or HTMLImageElement,
// or HTMLCanvasElement.
}
```

`width` or `height` can be specified when using background image, or
auto adapted by default.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








####### borderColor(Color)='transparent'

Border color of the text fragment.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








####### borderWidth(number)=0

Border width of the text fragment.

####### borderRadius(number)=0

Border radius of the text fragment.

####### padding(number|Array)=0

Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

####### shadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text block.

####### shadowBlur(number)=0

Show blur of the text block.

####### shadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text block.

####### shadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text block.
